msgSnippet: ... [....] ... Spell out your words, dammit! We re not making license plates! ... JUnit.org has this to say: JUnit is a regression testing framework written
messageBody:
Re: Re: HOW TO ASK QUESTIONS ON THIS GROUP

>   Date: Tue, 16 Oct 2001 01:02:10 -0700 (PDT)
>   From: venkatesh srinivasan <venky_gct@...>
>Subject: Re: Re: HOW TO ASK QUESTIONS ON THIS GROUP - also ...
[....]
>I asked that pariticular question(Y should i use

Spell out your words, dammit! We're not making license plates!

>Junit?) yesterday after searching and reading all docs
>including the framework.I didnt find any solid answer
>for the same.
>after that i thought there may be some real time
>issues which i may not aware..'coz of that only i
>posted that question.....

JUnit.org has this to say:

"JUnit is a regression testing framework written by Erich
Gamma and Kent Beck. It is used by the developer who
implements unit tests in Java. JUnit is Open Source Software,
released under the IBM Public License and hosted on SourceForge."

and

"Never in the field of software development was so much
owed by so many to so few lines of code"

Maybe that URL
         http://www.tuxedo.org/~esr/faqs/smart-questions.html
"How To Ask Questions The Smart Way"
        Copyright Â© 2001 by Eric S. Raymond

Should be included in the Welcome to the List message...
